title: Brisworthy stone circle
text:
Brisworthy stone circle () is a <a href="stone%20circle">stone circle</a> on <a href="Dartmoor">Dartmoor</a>, <a href="Devon">Devon</a>. It is located three miles east of the A386, northeast of the village of <a href="Shaugh%20Prior">Shaugh Prior</a>. It is three hundred metres from <a href="Ringmoor%20stone%20row%20and%20cairn%20circle">Ringmoor stone row and cairn circle</a>, and is one of the archaeological sites found in the <a href="Upper%20Plym%20Valley">Upper Plym Valley</a>.
Description.
The stone circle is a slight oval shape with a diameter of around 24 metres. It consists of 24 upright stones which are probably only half the original number. The stones are broad rather than tall, and are less than 1 metre tall.
Prior to 1909 most of the stones had fallen. It was restored in that year, and a trial excavation is said to have yielded a small amount of charcoal and one rough flint flake.
